✺ Pronunciation

Past tense -ed endings

Pronunciation Help
Sounds like /t/Sounds like /d/Sounds like /id/
finishedplayedvisited
helpedtraveledwaited
watchedstayedneeded

‣ Task 1

Listen and repeat.

  • 1. I liked the movie.
  • 2. I studied for a test.
  • 3. She stayed with us.
  • 4. We wanted to go home.

‣ Task 2

Read the sentences to a partner. Be sure to pronounce the past -ed verb endings correctly.

✺ Dictation

‣ Task 1

Listen to the conversation. Write the missing words.

A: Hi, Amy. What did you do this weekend?
B: Oh, not much. I (1)_____ home and (2)_____ on a project.
A: Is that all?
B: No. I also finished a good book. Later, I (3)_____ (4)_____ (5)_____. What about you?
A: I played tennis. The courts were crowded. I (6)_____ a long time to play!
B: What else did you do?
A: Some friends (7)_____ (8)_____ to dinner. Later, we went to a club and met a lot of (9)_____ (10)_____.

‣ Task 2

Practice the conversation with a partner. Be sure to pronounce the past -ed verb endings correctly.

✺ Conversation

Work in pairs. What did you do last weekend? Ask and answer questions about your weekend with your partner.

Intonation of Wh- questions

Use falling intonation for Wh- questions.

‣ Task 1

  • 5. What time→ is→ your→ train?↘

B: I take the subway.
A: How often do you (6)_____ (7)_____?
B: I take it every day.
A: How much (8)_____ (9)_____ (10)_____?

A: How do you like your new roommate?

B: She's (3)_____ (4)_____ at night. She watches TV and sings in her room.
A: So she's not as nice as your last roommate?
B: No. My last roommate was (5)_____ (6)_____ and considerate.
A: So what are you going to do?
B: Well, you know me. I'm (7)_____ (8)_____. I guess I won't do anything!

‣ Task 1

People are describing travel experiences. Is each statement true or false? Listen and check (x) the correct answer.

TrueFalse
1. Chelsea
a. She was eating in a Korean restaurant._____
b. She asked the woman to help her.__________
c. The woman invited her to join the family at their table.__________
d. She hasn't been in touch with the woman since then.__________
2. Brooke
a. She was traveling by train in Italy.__________
b. Her wallet was in one of her bags.__________
c. Someone stole on of her bags.__________
d. The person didn't steal the wallet.__________
3. Steve
a. He had extra clothes with him.__________
b. The airline did nothing to help.__________
c. His bags arrived four days later.__________
d. His bags had important things inside them.__________
4. Rachel
a. She got sick with food poisoning in Australia.__________
b. She was only sick for two days.__________
c. She knew someone in Sydney.__________
d. She went sightseeing for three days.__________

‣ Task 2

  2. Brooke _____
  3. Steve _____
  4. Rachel _____

  2. b. She wants to see a temple.
  3. c. She wants to see the museums she missed.
  4. d. She wants to scuba dive.

Reduction of was

Pronunciation Help
How we spell itHow we say it
waswuz

Listen and repeat.

  • 1.
    A: How was your trip?
    B: It was great.
  • 2.
    A: How was the food?
    B: It was okay.

Read the questions and answers with a partner. One student is A, and one student is B.

B: It was great! I had a wonderful time.
A: (3)_____ (4)_____ the food?
B: It was good! I ate a lot!
A: How (5)_____ (6)_____ (7)_____ there?
B: It was beautiful the whole time I was there.
A: So what was the best thing (8)_____ (9)_____ (10)_____?
B: The beaches!
